intro: Commicarpus ogadenensis, commonly known as the Ogaden commicarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora in its native region.
